roleset.name: give, send
roleset.note: DELIVER-V NOTES: Frame for deliver.01 based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet (from deliver.01-v)
DELIVERY-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls send-11.1. (from delivery.01-n)

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: The two units are Prentice Hall Information Services, which publishes tax, financial planning and business law information, among other services, and Prentice Hall Information Network, which *trace* electronically delivers tax information.

example.name: passive, with recipient
example.text: Two of the 757-200s are new aircraft *trace* *trace*-1 to be delivered *trace*-1 to American Trans Air, the main subsidiary of Amtran Inc., in December 1991 and January 1992.
example.arg: to American Trans Air, the main subsidiary of Amtran Inc.,

example.name: prepositional arg1
example.text: The city's Department of Consumer Affairs charged [Newmark& Lewis Inc.]-1 with *trace*-1 failing *trace*-1 to deliver on its promise of lowering prices.
example.arg: on its promise of lowering prices

example.name: ditransitive
example.text: The voters delivered Mr. Gonzalez a third mandate for his successes.
example.arg: a third mandate for his successes

example.name: just arg1
example.text: [The first five leased units]-1 were *trace*-1 to be delivered *trace*-1 in 1991.

example.name: intransitive!
example.text: Here she delivers, especially during her enthusiastically awful rendition of the ``Candy Man,'' which she sings while prancing around in a little cotton candy pink angora sweater that couldn't be more perfect.
example.arg: especially during her enthusiastically awful rendition of the ``Candy Man,'' which she sings while prancing around in a little cotton candy pink angora sweater that couldn't be more perfect

example.name: jeans, monkeys, recipient not LOC. All args
Args 1 & 2
example.text: the delivery of pay - TV networks to cable subscribers

roleset.name: give birth, assist in giving birth, giving birth or assisting in giving birth
roleset.note: DELIVER-V NOTES: Frame based on data in Clinical Notes corpus. Framed by Anwen March 2011. (from deliver.101-v)

example.name: Mother as Arg0
example.text: Maggie delivered a healthy baby boy yesterday.

example.name: Mother as Arg0
example.text: Maggie's delivery of baby Cooper went smoothly.

example.name: Doctor as Arg0
example.text: Dr. Brenda's delivery of the Mrs.Jacobs' twins went smoothly.
